com.experian.aperture.datastudio.sdk.step

Class Column

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.experian.aperture.datastudio.sdk.step.Column
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StepColumn

    public class Column
extends Object
implements StepColumn
    A basic class representing a user-defined column It can be used directly in custom steps, but it is recommended that non-advanced users use the Column object instead.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Column

        public Column(StepOutput step,
              int columnIndex,
              String name,
              String description)
        Creates a user-defined column whose parent is the given StepOutput. The columnIndex should be a unique index number ideally (but not necessarily) indicating its position in the list of output columns. The column's name will be displayed, and should be unique in the list of output columns - if it is not it will be renamed automatically later.
        Parameters:
        step - The step containing the column - must be a valid step and non-null
        columnIndex - The unique index of the column
        name - The column's name, it helps if it is unique, and cannot be null or empty
        description - The column's description, can be empty

      • setType

        public void setType(StepColumn.COLUMN_TYPE type)
        Description copied from interface: StepColumn
        Set the type of the column. Currently only used to set whether the column is boolean, and can be used by the validation step.
        Specified by:
        setType in interface StepColumn

      • getType

        public StepColumn.COLUMN_TYPE getType()
        Description copied from interface: StepColumn
        Get the type of the column. Currently only returns a BOOLEAN for validation columns, otherwise a string.
